item.title: Countries Want to Refresh Tobacco Warnings---and Put Them on Individual Cigarettes
item.description: Some countries want to go beyond warnings on packs by emblazoning messages like “Poison in Every Puff” on the cigarettes themselves.

item.title: McCarthy Has Two Weeks to Soothe GOP Critics and Keep Government Open
item.description: Congress faces an Oct. 1 deadline as Republicans press Speaker Kevin McCarthy on spending cuts, border security and the war in Ukraine.

item.title: The Executive Trying to Make Microsoft Smarter About AI
item.description: Chief Technology Officer Kevin Scott spearheaded the tech titan’s unlikely partnership with OpenAI.

item.title: Robinhood Wants to Grow Up
item.description: The app at the center of meme-stock frenzy now wants your retirement money.

item.title: South Korea's Interest in Nuclear Weapons Hasn't Gone Away---It's Just On Hold
item.description: Despite a recent pact with the U.S., many of the country’s leaders favor developing a homegrown nuclear option.

item.title: Mexico extradited Ovidio Guzmán, son of imprisoned drug lord Joaquín "El Chapo" Guzmán, to the U.S. to face drug charges.
item.description: Mexico extradited Ovidio Guzmán, son of imprisoned drug lord Joaquín “El Chapo” Guzmán, to the U.S. to face drug charges.

item.title: Former Wells Fargo executive Carrie Tolstedt won't serve prison time for her role in the bank'sfake-accounts scandal.
item.description: Former Wells Fargo executive Carrie Tolstedt won’t serve prison time for her role in the bank’s fake-accounts scandal.

item.title: Shares of Planet Fitness dropped 16% after the gym chain's board ousted longtime CEO Chris Rondeau.
item.description: Shares of Planet Fitness dropped 16% after the gym chain’s board ousted longtime CEO Chris Rondeau.

item.title: Irish authorities fined TikTok $367.2 million, saying it breached the country's data-protection laws.
item.description: Irish authorities fined TikTok $367.2 million, saying it breached the country’s data-protection laws.

item.title: Goldman Sachs is creating a unit within its investment banking division that will offer clients the chance to own a piece of a private sports team.
item.description: Goldman Sachs is creating a unit within its investment banking division that will offer clients the chance to own a piece of a private sports team.

item.title: A slump in technology companies' shares weighed on the S&P 500 Friday. The broad index fell 1.2%, while the Nasdaq and Dow shed 1.6% and 0.8%, respectively.
item.description: A slump in technology companies’ shares weighed on the S&P 500 Friday. The broad index fell 1.2%, while the Nasdaq and Dow shed 1.6% and 0.8%, respectively.

item.title: The UAW strike at three factories has caused ripple effects, as GM said it would soon idle another plant and Ford said it would temporarily lay off about 600 workers.
item.description: The UAW strike at three factories has caused ripple effects, as GM said it would soon idle another plant and Ford said it would temporarily lay off about 600 workers.

item.title: Texas state senators began deliberating Friday but didn't reach a verdict in the impeachment trial of Attorney General Ken Paxton.
item.description: Texas state senators began deliberating Friday but didn’t reach a verdict in the impeachment trial of Attorney General Ken Paxton.

item.title: The U.S. ambassador to Russia was granted access to jailed WSJ reporter Evan Gershkovich.
item.description: The U.S. ambassador to Russia was granted access to jailed WSJ reporter Evan Gershkovich.

item.title: Ukraine's military said it has recaptured a village south of Bakhmut, raising pressure on Russian troops in the occupied city.
item.description: Ukraine’s military said it has recaptured a village south of Bakhmut, raising pressure on Russian troops in the occupied city.

item.title: The West Virginia University Board of Governors voted to cut 28 academic programs and eliminate 143 faculty jobs.
item.description: The West Virginia University Board of Governors voted to cut 28 academic programs and eliminate 143 faculty jobs.

item.title: Chinese Defense Minister Li Shangfu was taken away last week by authorities for questioning, while U.S. officials say he is being removed from his post.
item.description: Chinese Defense Minister Li Shangfu was taken away last week by authorities for questioning, while U.S. officials say he is being removed from his post.

item.title: Special counsel Jack Smith's team urged a judge to limit what public statements Donald Trump can make about his federal prosecution in Washington.
item.description: Special counsel Jack Smith’s team urged a judge to limit what public statements Donald Trump can make about his federal prosecution in Washington.

item.title: Disney's CIO left the company, the second C-level executive to leave in under three months.
